intro: Hymenidium heracleifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved hymenidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with broad, ovate leaflets and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. The plant is often found in meadows and along riverbanks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
